name: Jurassic Golf
description:
GOAL 

This poor dinosaur does not have any arms! Please help it to throw its eggs into its nest, by roaring on them (RAW!).

This game is a tribute to the minigolf game from Wario Land 3. 

The ultimate goal is to finish 10 levels by roaring the less as possible.

 SCREEN INFORMATION

 DINOSAURS & RAW

You can choose between three dinosaurs:

      Putterosaurus
Can't throw the egg far away, but is very precise.

     Wedgeirus
Can throw the egg to a raisonnable distance, and is quite precise.

    Driveraptor
Can throw the egg very far away, but is not very precise.

A roar is done in three steps:

  1. To init a roar, click on the "Start" button: the cursor will start to move on the "Raw power" bar;
  2. Click once again on the button to set the "power" of your roar: it'll determine the distance of your egg. If the cursor goes to the far right of the bar, you loose one try!
  3. Click one last time when the cursor is on the left area of the "Raw power" bar to stop it.
    If it ends on the green square, your egg will move to the exact distance set by the first cursor.
    If it ends on the left blue area, its distance will be decreased by 1.
    If it ends on the right blue area, its distance will be increased by 1.
     If the cursor goes to the far left of the bar, you loose one try!

 OBSTACLES

If you aren't precise enough, your egg can be dropped into some obstacles...

    Bunker
The sand disabled the max distance of your dinosaur. If you try to set the power to the max despite of all, you will loose one try. It also has some impact on the cursors speed!

    Rough
The grass makes us difficult to see the cursors below the "Raw power" bar.  It also has some impact on the cursors speed!

    Water
You loose one try and the egg goes back to its previous position.

 CREDITS

As said in the intro of this page, this game is a tribute to the minigolf game from Wario Land 3. 

A really big thanks to @KenneyNL for a lot of graphical and audio assets: most tiles in this game are edited versions (from myself) to its wonderful work.

The dinosaur (and egg) sprites are edited versions (from myself) to a cute spritesheet from @DemChing.

The background music is from this music pack, by @phoenix1291.

The whole code is in pure CSS and VanillaJS, no framework involved.
That's said, it's based on a mini-library on my own (that I've built during the development of this game). I'll probably open source it on GitHub some day (when it'll be cleaner :p).

Will you beat my own score?
